name: Clover Club
description: Originally named for a Philadelphia social club with roots tracing back to the 1880s, the Clover Club was, for decades, one of the marks of the sophisticated boozer, a manly drink (despite its pink hue) shaken by the bucketload in the wood-paneled lounges of the early 20th century.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 ounce fresh lemon juice (about 1/2 a lemon)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and shake, without ice, for 10 seconds, to aerate the egg white. Open and fill with ice, then reseal and shake very hard for 10 seconds; strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Note: Some recipes call for the addition of a 1/2 ounce or so of dry vermouth. A worthwhile experiment.
